channel.title: Alper Demiryay — Notes & Experiments
channel.description: Networking, broadband platforms (DPI/BNG/CGNAT), data pipelines, Python automation, and personal notes.

item.title: ClickHouse vs Vertica: Overview & Use-Cases
item.description: SQL columnar OLAP comparison: ClickHouse excels at real-time analytics, massive ingest, and time-series/logs with eventual mutations; Vertica shines for enterprise BI with strong ANSI SQL, robust MERGE/UPSERT, and workload governance. Includes quick picker and feature checklist.

item.title: HTTP Digest Authentication (RFC 7616): How it works & example
item.description: Digest in a nutshell: server sends 401 with WWW-Authenticate (realm, nonce, qop, algorithm); client replies with Authorization: Digest computed from A1 = user:realm:password (or H(A1):nonce:cnonce for -sess), A2 = method:uri (or method:uri:H(body) for auth-int), and response = H( H(A1):nonce:nc:cnonce:qop:H(A2) ). Prefers SHA-256 / SHA-512/256 (MD5 for legacy). Post includes a fully worked example (Mufasa / 'Circle of Life'), exact inputs/outputs, and notes on nonce-count, cnonce, userhash, and mutual auth (Authentication-Info).

item.title: What is an RSS feed?
item.description: An intro to RSS/Atom, why it’s still great in 2025, and how to add a feed to a static site.

item.title: Cloudflare Email Routing → Gmail marks forwarded mail as spam: causes & fixes

item.description: Magic bytes like 78 9C, raw vs zlib vs gzip, and a tiny Python snippet to emit identical blobs.

item.description: Idioms from set() to ordered dedupe, plus big-list perf notes.
